result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew William Okey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew William Okey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew William Okey was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges.  *Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  *Compliance and completion of PTSD RRTP program.  *Granted 2 days credit if probation is revoked.
*Bond of $500.00 to be applied to costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew William Okey

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2. Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.  Atty Zamzow agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Withhold Sentence; 2 years Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $243.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*$100.00 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Compliance and completion of PTSD RRTP program 
Credit =  2 days if revoked
bond to be applied

Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.
Plea hearing on May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Final pre-trial at 04-01-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 05-12-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Zamzow informed him today of Mr. Okey's status and asks that a trial be set.  Atty Zamzow agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided and states that the parties are requesting one more reset.  Atty Zamzow states that yes an offer was received and asks for a little more time.

BY THE COURT: Reset.
bond continued.

Atty Zamzow has questions regarding the bond with contact with the victim.
Court states that there was a no contact ordered.
Atty Hendee states that there was a modification of no violent or abusive contact. Atty Hendee states that there was not a new bond signed.
BY THE COURT:  Court states that there was a waiver filed but a new bond was never signed.  Court orders that the defendant sign a new bond with the amended bond condition.  Return date scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Zamzow states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a Not Guilty plea.

  BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Atty Zamzow makes statement.  Court questions defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Arraignment scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in questioning the defendant before court; the defendant did not want to get an Attorney but he did not understand what the Preliminary Hearing actually is.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that he does not qualify for PD.  Defendant wants to get his own Attorney; he does not want the court to appoint an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
WAIVER OF NO CONTACT PROVISION OF BOND- APPROVED BY COURT

with conditions:
*No contact with Kimberly Okey
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerence

Defendant Andrew William Okey in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant states that he contacted the PD office.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states that he thought the PD office was going to call in today for the hearing.  Defendant states that he has an appointment with the VA in a week and asks for a signature bond.  He also states that he has to take care of the victim's daughter.
Atty Gumz called in and said that the defendant does not qualify for PD.  Court explains that to the defendant.  Court gives the defendant the option of a court appointed Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Kimberly Okey
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerence

Court questions the defendant regarding time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; Set for Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
